body:
Thanks for pointing this out @dterei!

As a first step I suggest we remove the `vu` and `iter` tags by default (they were added for a Load Impact specific use case), and add a CLI option to whitelist the HTTP tags that should be included for HTTP metrics (point 2 in your list). So something like `--http-tags method,status,vu,iter` if you'd want to include just those four tags.

Point 1 and 3 also sound like good (future) additions to me.
A fix for this would be very nice. I also hit the max limit of 1,000,000 series within 15 minutes when testing k6 today.

`iter` and `vu` are also included in system metrics like `data_received`, `data_sent` and `iteration_duration`.

I wonder if the option should be renamed to `--tags method,status,vu,iter`

Yes, it's also included in those metrics. I've a PR on the way for this (see https://github.com/loadimpact/k6/tree/feature/default-tags-option for WIP). I call the CLI option `--default-tags` and you select which ones to include with a namespace (`--default-tags "vu:id, http:method"` etc.).

issue.title: Adding tags automatically to all metrics.

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
It is useful to have an option (CLI and in code) to add tags to all metrics.

`--tags=mytag1:value1,mytag2:value2`

```
export let options = {
  vus: 20,
  duration: '30s',
  tags: {mytag1: "value1", mytag2: "value2"}
}
```

This is useful for the Cloud Collector and it could also be a good addition when reporting to other Collectors (InfluxDB, prometheus...), for example, to differentiate different tests or environments.

The API syntax is related to #485

issue.title: Add remote address information to metrics

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
It could be useful to add the remote address information as an optional `tag` for `http` metrics.

[net.http.Request.RemoteAddr](https://golang.org/pkg/net/http/#Request)

To avoid adding more tags, it could be implemented after #485

body: @ppcano Hm, true, don't remember why I went with the namespaced approach. Will change that and create a PR so we can get this into master and ready for a new release.

issue.title: System tags CLI option

repository.name: k6
repository.description: A modern load testing tool, using Go and JavaScript

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
Adds a CLI option `--default-tags "url,method,status"` to specify which tags to include in metrics output, a whitelist. Collectors have the possibility to override and force certain tags to be included.

The following tags can be specified:
- `error` (http)
- `group` (http)
- `iter` (vu)
- `method` (http)
- `name` (http)
- `ocsp_status` (http)
- `proto` (http)
- `status` (http, websocket)
- `subprotocol` (websocket)
- `tls_version` (http)
- `url` (http, websocket)
- `vu` (vu)

Closes #485.
